ARTICLE 731
Insurance Companies
731.01      License required.
731.02      Filing copy of State license.
731.03      Issuance of licenses.
731.04      Payment of license fees.
731.05     Amount of license fees.
731.06     Agent's license and fee.
731.07     Soliciting for unlicensed company.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
State licensing of insurers - see W. Va. Code 33-3-1 et seq.
 
731.01 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No insurance company or association shall transact the business of
insurance, enter into any contract of insurance, or issue or deliver within the
City any policy or contract of insurance until such company or association
shall have obtained a license or certificate of authority therefor from the
Licensing Officer.
(1961 Code Sec. 731.01)
731.02 FILING COPY OF STATE LICENSE.
   Every insurance company or association shall, before issuing a policy,
making a contract of insurance, or otherwise engaging in the business of
insurance in the City, file with the Licensing Officer a certified copy of the
license or certificate of authority issued to it by the Insurance Commissioner
of the State.
(1961 Code Sec. 731.02)
731.03 ISSUANCE OF LICENSES.
   Upon receiving such certified copy, the Licensing Officer shall issue to the
insurance company or association a license certificate, authorizing it to issue
policies, make contracts of insurance, and transact business in the City.
(1961 Code Sec. 731.03)
731.04 PAYMENT OF LICENSE FEES.
   On or before May 1 of each and every year, every insurance company or
association licensed to transact business in the City shall pay to the City
Treasurer an annual license fee for the calendar year.
(Ord. 2410. Passed 8-14-56.)
731.05 AMOUNT OF LICENSE FEES.
   (a)   Fire Insurance Companies. The annual license fee for a fire insurance
company or association, or any other company or association issuing fire
insurance policies or coverage against loss by fire shall be one hundred
dollars ($100.00).
   (b)   Casualty, and Other Companies. The annual license fee for casualty
companies and all other insurance companies, other than life insurance
companies shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00).
   (c)   Life Insurance Companies. The annual license fee for a life insurance
company shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00).
(Ord. 2410. Passed 8-14-56.)
731.06 AGENT'S LICENSE AND FEE.
   (a)   No person shall act in the solicitation or procurement of applications
for, or policies of insurance for any insurance company or association within
the City without first procuring a license or a certificate of authority as an
agent from the Licensing Officer.
   (b)   Agents' licenses or certificates hereafter issued shall be renewable
on July 1 in each year. The fee for the issuance of the licenses shall be one
dollar ($1.00).
(1961 Code Sec. 731.06)
731.07 SOLICITING FOR UNLICENSED COMPANY.
   No person shall issue or deliver within the City any policy or contract of
insurance of any insurance company or solicit or procure policies or risks from
or in any insurance company or association, which has not obtained a license to
transact business within the City.
(1961 Code Sec. 731.07)
ARTICLE 733
Itinerant Vendors
733.01      Definition; application.
733.02      Special sales; advertising; application for license.
733.03     License fee.
733.04     Violation.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Unnecessary noises - see GEN. OFF.
509.05
Trespass - see GEN. OFF.
533.02
Hawkers and peddlers - see B.R.&T. Art.
727
 
733.01 DEFINITION; APPLICATION.
   When used in this article, "itinerant vendor" includes all persons who
engage or conduct within the City, either in one locality, or in traveling from
place to place, a temporary or transient business of selling goods, wares and
merchandise; and who, for the purpose of carrying on such business, use, lease
or occupy either in whole or in part, a room, building or other structure, or
who use, lease or occupy for such purposes a room or rooms in any hotel or
lodging house for the exhibition and sale of such goods, wares and merchandise.
   Itinerant Vendors as used in this article also describes retail sales,
services, etc. habitually traveling from place to place, traveling around a
region working for short periods of time, not operating out of the permanent
brick and mortar location of such business. Types of such itinerant vendors
include but are not limited to: coin/ jewelry/ estates purchasing pawn shop
like entities; merchandise sales related to sports, campaigns, special event
type memorabilia/ t-shirts/ hats etc.; fireworks etc.
   The person so engaged shall not be relieved from the provisions of this
article by reason of association temporarily with any local dealer, trader,
merchant or auctioneer, or by conducting such temporary or transient business
in connection with or as part of the business of, or in the name of, any local
dealer, trader, merchant or auctioneer. The provisions of this article shall
not apply to sales made to persons by commercial travelers, or selling agents
in the usual course of business, nor to bona-fide sales of goods, wares or
merchandise by sample for future delivery; nor to hawkers or peddlers in the
streets, roads or highways, from packs or vehicles; nor to persons selling meat
or the products of the farm, garden or dairy, nor to any sales of goods, wares
or merchandise on the grounds of any agricultural association during the
continuance of any annual fair held by such association; nor to any sales by
societies acting for charitable, religious or benevolent purposes; nor to
judicial sales directed by law, or under the orders of any court; nor to the
sales of the common necessities of life in any public market place. (Ord.
15708. Passed 5-17-22.)
733.02 SPECIAL SALES; ADVERTISING; APPLICATION FOR LICENSE.
   No itinerant vendor shall advertise, represent or hold forth a sale of
goods, wares or merchandise as a bankrupt, insolvent, assignee, trustee,
estate, executor, administrator, receiver, attorney, manufacturer's wholesale
or closing-out-sale, or a sale of any goods damaged by smoke, fire, water or
otherwise, unless before so doing he shall state in writing, under oath, to the
Licensing Officer at the time he makes application for a license, hereinafter
provided for, all the facts relating to the reason and character of such
special sale as advertised, held forth or represented, including a statement of
the names of the persons from whom such goods, wares or merchandise were
purchased, and the date of the delivery of the same to the person applying for
license; the place, if any, where such goods, wares or merchandise were
previously exposed for sale, and such details as are necessary to exactly
locate and fully identify all such goods, wares and merchandise proposed to be
sold. And such itinerant vendor shall also include in such statement the name
and residence of the owner or owners in whose interest the business is
conducted, to be kept on file in the office of the Licensing Officer and a
record shall be kept by the Licensing Officer of all such statements, in
convenient form and open to public inspection.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
733.03 LICENSE FEE.
   The annual license fee to carry on the business of itinerant vendor shall be
five hundred dollars ($500.00).
(Ord. 10485. Passed 4-19-94.)
733.04 VIOLATION.
   Every itinerant vendor who sells or exhibits for sale at public or private
sale, any goods, wares or merchandise without first obtaining a license
therefor, and in all other respects complying with the provisions of this
Business Regulation and Taxation Code, or who makes any false statement in
reference to the matter set out in Section
733.02, or who fails to comply with the requirements of any of the sections of
this Code, and every person, whether principal or agent, who, by circular,
handbills, newspaper or in any manner advertises such sale, as herein
described, before proper licenses are issued to the vendor, and before he has
complied with the provisions of this Code, shall be guilty of a violation of
this Code.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
ARTICLE 735
Junk Dealers
735.01      Definitions.
735.02      License required.
735.03      License fee.
735.04      State license prerequisite.
735.05      Record of purchases.
735.06      Tags on purchased articles.
735.07     Purchases to be kept separate; holding period.
735.08     Inspection of records by police; stolen goods.
735.09     Liability of dealers for actions of agents.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Loads dropping or leaking - see TRAF.
347.04
 
735.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this article:
   (a)   "Junk" means old or scrap gold, copper, brass, rope, rags, batteries,
paper, rubber, automobile parts, iron, steel and other old scrap ferrous or
nonferrous metals.
   (b)   "Junk dealers" includes all persons engaged in the business of buying
or selling junk as hereinbefore defined.
   (c)   "Junk dealer's agents" includes all persons who buy or sell junk for
or on behalf of a junk dealer, but "junk dealer's agent" shall not be construed
to include any persons regularly employed upon a salary by a regularly licensed
junk dealer engaged in such business within the City.
   (d)   "Itinerant junk collector" includes only such persons who gather junk
from place to place with the aid of a cart or vehicle hand-drawn or propelled,
who have no fixed place of business.
      (Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
735.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   A annual license is required in order to carry on the business of a junk
dealer with a warehouse, storehouse or yard, or for a junk dealer's agent or
itinerant junk collector.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
735.03 LICENSE FEE.
   The junk dealer's license fee shall be twenty-five dollars ($25.00). The
license fee to act as junk dealer's agent or itinerant junk collector shall be
ten dollars ($10.00).
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
735.04 STATE LICENSE PREREQUISITE.
   No license shall be issued under this article until the applicant produces
to the Licensing Officer a valid State license therefor.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
735.05 RECORD OF PURCHASES.
   Every junk dealer shall keep in his place of business a book in which shall
be legibly written in the English language and numbered consecutively at the
time of purchasing property in the course of his business, an accurate account
of such transaction setting forth a description of the goods, articles or
things purchased or received, the time of receiving same, the name, sex, color
and residence of the persons selling or delivering the same, and all other
facts and circumstances respecting such purchase. This section shall not apply
to the purchase of rags, bones, old iron and paper by junk dealers.
(1961 Code Sec. 735.05)
735.06 TAGS ON PURCHASED ARTICLES.
   Every junk dealer shall also legibly write in English on tags approved by
the Chief of Police the date of each purchase made and the name of the seller,
which tag shall be securely fastened on the property purchased and shall be
numbered to correspond with the number of the description of such property in
his book.
(1961 Code Sec. 735.06)
735.07 PURCHASES TO BE KEPT SEPARATE; HOLDING PERIOD.
   All property purchased by a junk dealer shall be kept separate and distinct
from all other property or merchandise in his place of business until after the
expiration of ten days from the time on which such report has been made to the
Chief of Police of the purchase thereof. Such property or merchandise shall not
be sold or disposed of in any manner during that period.
(1961 Code Sec. 735.07)
735.08 INSPECTION OF RECORDS BY POLICE; STOLEN GOODS.
   It shall be the duty of every junk dealer and of every person in his employ,
to admit to his premises during business hours any member of the Police
Department to examine any record on the premises, as well as the articles
purchased or received, and to search for and take possession of any article
known by him to be missing or known or believed to have been stolen, without
the formality of a writ of search warrant or any other process.
(1961 Code Sec. 735.08)
735.09 LIABILITY OF DEALERS FOR ACTIONS OF AGENTS.
   Every licensed junk dealer shall be liable to all the penalties provided for
the violation of any of the provisions of this article whether such violation
be committed by himself, his agent, clerk or employee.
(1961 Code Sec. 735.09)

ARTICLE 741
Nonintoxicating Beer
741.01      Definitions.
741.02      City license issuance.
741.03      License as distributor or brewer.
741.04     License fees.
741.05     Transfer of license.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
State law provisions - see W. Va. Code 11-16-3 et seq.
Nonintoxicating beer regulations - see GEN. OFF. Art.
521
Liquor sales tax - see B.R.&T. Art.
785
 
741.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purposes of this article, the words "nonintoxicating beer",
"person", "retailer", "distributor", "brewer", and "original container", shall
have the meaning as they now are, or as they or any of them may hereafter be,
defined by the Statutes of West Virginia.
(1961 Code Sec. 741.01)
741.02 CITY LICENSE ISSUANCE.
   The Licensing Officer shall issue a City license to sell nonintoxicating
beer upon the issuance of a State license and the payment of the license fee.
(1961 Code Sec. 741.02)
741.03 LICENSE AS DISTRIBUTOR OR BREWER.
   Licenses, as a distributor or brewer, shall be issued by the Licensing
Officer upon written application and upon the exhibition of a State license as
such distributor or brewer and the payment of the license fees provided in
Section
741.04.
(1961 Code Sec. 741.03)
741.04 LICENSE FEES.
   The annual license fee for dealers in nonintoxicating beer shall be as
follows:
   (a)   Retail Dealer. In the case of a retail dealer, the license fee shall
be seventy-five dollars ($75.00) for each place of business in the City, except
that such license fee for social, fraternal or public clubs, not operating for
profit, and having been in continuous operation for two years or more
immediately preceding the date of application, shall be fifty dollars ($50.00).
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
    (b)   Package Dealer. In the case of a package dealer, the license shall be
five dollars ($5.00) for each place of business in the City, for unchilled
(warm) beer, and seventy-five dollars ($75.00) if chilled (cold), and such
license shall authorize the licensee to sell nonintoxicating beer at retail in
bottles, cans or other sealed containers only, and only for consumption off the
licensed premises and provided that such license may be issued only to the
proprietor or owner of a grocery store. For the purpose of this section, the
term "grocery store" includes any retail establishment commonly known as a
grocery store or delicatessen, where food or food products are sold for
consumption off the premises.
      (Ord. 5733. Passed 6-24-75.)
   (c)   Distributor. In the case of a distributor, the license shall be one
hundred twenty-five dollars ($125.00) for each place of business in the City.
   (d)   Brewer. In the case of a brewer, the license fee shall be five hundred
dollars ($500.00) for each place of manufacture located in the City.
   For any license granted for a period less than a year, the fee shall be
computed from the annual fee quarterly in proportion to the remainder of the
license year.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6- 3-58.)
741.05 TRANSFER OF LICENSE.
   No license issued under Section
741.02 shall be transferred to another person, nor shall the location of the
premises to which the license relates be changed, until the following
requirements are met:
   (a)   Advance notice of the intention to transfer or change the location
shall have been made in writing to the City Licensing Officer; and
   (b)   The written consent of the State Tax Commissioner to the proposed
transfer or change of location shall have been exhibited to the Licensing
Officer.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)

ARTICLE 745
Parking Lots
745.01      Definition; application.
745.02      License required.
745.03     License fee.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
Parking generally - see TRAF. Art.
361
 
745.01 DEFINITION; APPLICATION.
   Any person who shall, for profit, keep, operate, maintain or carry on the
business, either in person or by agent or employee, of parking automobiles or
vehicles upon an open lot shall be deemed an "operator of a parking lot" under
this article. The license fee shall only be applicable to those persons who
carry on the business of a parking lot for profit at locations within the City
regularly established for the purpose, and shall not be construed to include
persons who at disconnected intervals, provide parking space for automobiles
and other vehicles, unless such disconnected intervals consume more than
twenty-five percent (25%) of the days of the license year.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
745.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   An annual license is required in order to keep, carry on or operate the
business of a parking lot for profit.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
745.03 LICENSE FEE.
   The license fee to keep, carry on or operate the business of a parking lot,
for profit, shall be fifty dollars ($50.00) for each lot.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
ARTICLE 747
Pawnbrokers
747.01      Definition.
747.02      License required.
747.03      License fee.
747.04      Goods to be received only at place designated in license.
747.05      Name over door.
747.06      Records of purchases and pledges.
747.07      Daily reports to police.
747.08      False records or reports.
747.09      Issuance and contents of pawn tickets.
747.10     Inspection of records and articles purchased or pledged.
747.11     Hours of business.
747.12     Period pledged articles to be kept.
747.13     Period property purchased to be kept.
747.14     Receiving property from minors, intoxicated persons, others.
747.15     Report to police when theft suspected.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
Precious metal dealers - see W. Va. Code 61-3-51
 
747.01 DEFINITION.
   "Pawnbroker" includes any person, firm, partnership, association or
corporation engaged in the business of lending money on deposit or pledge of
personal property or other valuable thing, other than securities or printed
evidence of indebtedness, or in the business of purchasing personal property,
such as articles made of or containing gold, silver, platinum or other precious
metals or jewels of any description for the purpose of reducing or smelting
them into any form different from their condition or construction when
purchased and reselling or marketing the product.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
747.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   An annual license is required in order to engage in the business of
pawnbroker.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
747.03 LICENSE FEE.
   The license fee to engage in the business of pawnbroker shall be one hundred
dollars ($100.00).
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
747.04 GOODS TO BE RECEIVED ONLY AT PLACE DESIGNATED IN LICENSE.
   No person licensed to conduct the business of pawnbroker shall purchase,
receive or take goods in pawn of any description at any place other than that
designated in his license.
(1961 Code Sec. 747.04)
747.05 NAME OVER DOOR.
   Every person licensed to conduct the business of pawnbroker shall cause his
name or the name of the firm, with the words "Licensed Pawnbroker", to be
printed in large legible characters, and placed over the outside of the door of
his shop or place of business.
(1961 Code Sec. 747.05)
747.06 RECORDS OF PURCHASES AND PLEDGES.
   Every person engaged in carrying on the business of a pawnbroker within the
City shall keep a book in which shall be legibly written in the English
language, simultaneously with the transaction to which it relates, an accurate
description of such articles as he may purchase, or as may be pledged to him,
the time of such purchase or pledge, the amount of money paid on account of
such purchase or loan, the time within which such pledge is to be redeemed, and
the name and place of residence, including the street number, if any there be,
of the person from whom such articles are received. Where any watch is sold, or
pledged, to such pawnbroker, he shall also enter in such book the number of the
case and movement of such watch and the name of the maker thereof, so far as he
may be able to do so.
(1961 Code Sec. 747.06)
747.07 DAILY REPORTS TO POLICE.
   Every person engaged in carrying on the business of pawnbroker within the
City shall, before 12:00 noon of every business day, report to the Chief of
Police on a blank form to be furnished by the Police Department a description
of all articles purchased by him, or pledged to him, on the business day
immediately preceding such report, together with the number of any pawn ticket
which he may have issued in case of pledge, the amount loaned upon account of
the pledge, the name and residence and description of the person from whom such
pledge was received, or from whom any article was purchased.
(1961 Code Sec. 747.07)
747.08 FALSE RECORDS OR REPORTS.
   No person engaged in carrying on the business of pawnbroker within the City
or any clerk or employee of such person shall make a false entry in the book
required to be kept by Section
747.06 or make a report required by Section
747.07 which is false in any material particular.
(1961 Code Sec. 747.08)
747.09 ISSUANCE AND CONTENTS OF PAWN TICKETS.
   Every person engaged in carrying on the business of pawnbroker within the
City shall, at the time of receiving any article pledged for the payment of
money, upon the demand of the party making such pledge, deliver to such party a
memorandum, in writing, signed by the party so carrying on the business,
containing a description of the article, the date of such loan and the time
within which such article is to be redeemed.
(1961 Code Sec. 747.09)
747.10 INSPECTION OF RECORDS AND ARTICLES PURCHASED OR PLEDGED.
   The book provided for in Section
747.06 shall, at all times, be open to the inspection of the Chief of Police,
and to any of the policemen who may be designated by the Chief of Police to
make such inspection, and all articles purchased by or pledged to any person
carrying on the business of pawnbroker, shall, at all times, be open to like
inspection.
(1961 Code Sec. 747.10)
747.11 HOURS OF BUSINESS.
   No person engaged in carrying on the business of pawnbroker within the City
shall purchase any article or receive such article as a pledge from any person
between the hours of 8:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m. from April 1 to November 1 of any
year nor between the hours of 7:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m., from November 1 to April
1 of any year, except that on Saturday evenings such persons shall have the
right to purchase any article or receive such article in pledge until 11:00
p.m.
(1961 Code Sec. 747.11)
747.12 PERIOD PLEDGED ARTICLES TO BE KEPT.
   No person engaged in carrying on the business of a pawnbroker within the
City shall sell any article which may have been pledged to him on account of
any loan until the expiration of three months from the date upon which such
loan shall become due.
(1961 Code Sec. 747.12)
747.13 PERIOD PROPERTY PURCHASED TO BE KEPT.
   No person carrying on the business of a pawnbroker within the City shall
sell, or remove from his place of business, any property purchased by him until
the expiration of ten days after such purchase.
(1961 Code Sec. 747.13)
747.14 RECEIVING PROPERTY FROM MINORS, INTOXICATED PERSONS, OTHERS.
   No person carrying on the business of a pawnbroker within the City, or the
clerk or other employee of such person, shall knowingly purchase or receive as
a pledge any property from any person who is under eighteen years of age, any
person who is intoxicated or who is an habitual drunkard, any person who is, or
is reputed to be, a thief or who is, or who is reputed to be, an associate of
thieves, or any person who is, or is reputed to be, a receiver of stolen
property.
(1961 Code Sec. 747.14)
747.15 REPORT TO POLICE WHEN THEFT SUSPECTED.
   It shall be the duty of every person engaged in carrying on the business of
a pawnbroker, within the City, when any person shall offer to sell or pledge to
him any property which he knows or has reason to believe is not the property of
the party so offering it, to notify the Chief of Police or some police officer
of the City of such offer and of the facts connected therewith.
(1961 Code Sec. 747.15)
ARTICLE 749
Photographers
749.01      License required.
749.02     License issuance; fees; bond.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
Street photographers - see B.R.&T. Art.
765
 
749.01 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   An annual license is required in order to carry on or conduct the business
of photography.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
749.02 LICENSE ISSUANCE; FEES; BOND.
   The license fee shall be ten dollars ($10.00). Licenses under this article
shall be issued on the basis of the annual fee only to applicants who intend to
remain in business permanently in the City, and evidence of such intent shall
be an established place of photographic business in the City for a period of
one year preceding date of application for an annual license. The license fee
to carry on or conduct the business of photography, to any person who has not
had an established place of photographic business in the City during the year
preceding date of application for a license shall be twenty dollars ($20.00) a
day; provided, however, that such applicant may state, under oath, that he
intends to continue in such business permanently, and he may then post a bond
in the amount of five hundred dollars ($500.00). Such bond shall be conditioned
on the payment of the daily license fee in case the applicant fails to become a
permanent photographer under this section, in which case a license shall be
issued on an annual basis.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
ARTICLE 750
Private Clubs
750.01      License required; sale of alcoholic liquors by licensee authorized.
750.02      Definitions.
750.03      License application; information and verification.
750.04      License issuance or refusal; nontransferability; valid at one
location.
750.05     License fee.
750.06     License revocation or suspension.
750.99     Violations and penalties.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to license - see W. Va. Code 8-13-7; 60-7-7
Liquor control - see GEN. OFF. Art.
521
Nonintoxicating beer - see B.R.&T. Art.
741
Liquor sales tax - see B.R.&T. Art.
785
 
750.01 LICENSE REQUIRED; SALE OF ALCOHOLIC LIQUORS BY LICENSEE AUTHORIZED.
   A license is required in order to operate within the City as a private club
as defined in this article. A licensee granted a license pursuant to the
provisions hereof shall be authorized to sell alcoholic liquors, other than in
sealed packages, for consumption on the premises of such licensee, to its
members and their guests, and such licensee shall be further authorized to keep
and maintain on the premises a supply of alcoholic liquors in such quantities
as may be appropriate for the conduct of the operations thereof.
(Ord. 3453. Passed 4-11-67.)
750.02 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this article, the following terms shall have the meanings
ascribed to them in this section unless a different meaning is clearly
indicated in the context.
   (a)   "Private club" means any corporation or unincorporated association
which either:
      (1)   Belongs to or is affiliated with a nationally recognized fraternal
or veterans' organization, which is operated exclusively for the benefit of its
members, which pays no part of its income to its shareholders or individual
premises, to which club only duly elected or approved dues- paying members in
good standing of such corporation or association and their guests while in the
company of a member are admitted, and to which club the general public is not
admitted, and which club maintains in such building or on such premises
suitable kitchen and dining facilities with related equipment for serving food
to members and guests; or
      (2)   Is a nonprofit social club, which is operated exclusively for the
benefit of its members, which pays no part of its income to its shareholders or
individual members, which owns or leases a building or other premises, to which
club only duly elected or approved dues-paying members in good standing of such
corporation or association and their guests while in the company of a member
are admitted, and to which club the general public is not admitted, and which
club maintains in such building or on such premises a suitable kitchen and
dining facility with related equipment for serving food to members and their
guests; or
      (3)   Is organized and operated for legitimate purposes, which has at
least 100 duly elected or approved dues-paying members in good standing, which
owns or leases a building or other premises, to which club only duly elected or
approved dues-paying member in good standing of such corporation or association
and their guests while in the company of a member are admitted and to which
club the general public is not admitted, and which club maintains in such
building or on such premises a suitable kitchen and dining facility with
related equipment and employs a sufficient number of persons for serving meals
to members and their guests; or
      (4)   Is organized for legitimate purposes and owns or leases a building
or other limited premises in any State, County or Municipal park or at any
airport, in which building or premises a club has been established, to which
club are admitted only duly elected and approved dues-paying members in good
standing and their guests while in the company of a member and to which club
the general public is not admitted, and which maintains in connection with such
club a suitable kitchen and dining facility and related equipment and employs a
sufficient number of persons for serving meals in such club to members and
their guests.
   (b)   "Licensee" means the holder of a license to operate a private club
granted under the provisions of this article, which license shall remain
unexpired, unsuspended and unrevoked.
   (c)   "Applicant" means a private club applying for a license under the
provisons of this article.
750.03 LICENSE APPLICATION; INFORMATION AND VERIFICATION.
   (a)   An application for a license to operate within the City as a private
club shall be made on such form as may be prescribed by the City Licensing
Officer and shall include:
      (1)   The name of the applicant;
      (2)   If such applicant is an unincorporated association, the names and
addresses of the members of its governing board;
      (3)   If such applicant is a corporation, the names and addresses of its
officers and directors;
      (4)   The place at which such applicant will conduct its operations and
whether the same is owned or leased by the applicant;
      (5)   The number of members of the applicant;
      (6)   The name or names of any national organizations with which such
applicant is affiliated and the nature of such affiliation;
      (7)   The number and date of the private club license issued to such
applicant by the State of West Virginia; and
      (8)   Such other information as the City Licensing Officer may reasonably
require.
   (b)   Such application shall be verified by each member of the governing
board of the applicant if an unincorporated association or, if the applicant is
a corporation, by each of its officers and all members of its board of
directors. Such application shall be accompanied by the license fee hereinafter
prescribed.
(Ord. 3492. Passed 7-25-67.)
   (c)   Under no circumstance shall any college fraternity or sorority be
issued a license to operate a private club.
 
   (d)   No license to operate a private club will be issued to applicants who
discriminate against any person or group of persons because of race or color of
such person or group of persons except clubs as defined in Section
750.02(a)(1) and (2).
750.04 LICENSE ISSUANCE OR REFUSAL; NONTRANSFERABILITY; VALID AT ONE LOCATION.
   Upon receipt of the application referred to in Section
750.03, together with the accompanying fee, the City Licensing Officer may
conduct such investigation as he may deem necessary to determine the accuracy
of the matters contained in such application and whether the applicant is a
bona-fide private club of good reputation in this City. If it appears that such
applicant is a bona-fide private club and of good reputation, that there is no
false statement contained in such application, and that the applicant has been
issued a private club license by the State, the City Licensing Officer shall
issue a license authorizing the applicant to sell alcoholic liquors as provided
in Section
750.01; otherwise the City Licensing Officer shall refuse to issue a license.
Such license shall be of such form and design as the City Licensing Officer
shall prescribe. A license shall authorize the licensee to sell alcoholic
liquors at only one location. A license issued under the provisions of this
article shall not be transferable.
(Ord. 3492. Passed 7-25-67.)
750.05 LICENSE FEE.
   The annual license fee for a license issued under the provisions of this
article shall be as follows:
   (a)   The fee for a license issued to a fraternal or veterans' organization
or a nonprofit social club shall be three hundred seventy-five dollars
($375.00).
   (b)   The fee for a license issued to a private club other than a private
club of the type specified in subsection (a) hereof shall be five hundred
dollars ($500.00) if such private club has less than 1,000 members, and one
thousand two hundred fifty dollars ($1,250) if such private club has 1,000 or
more members.
   The fee for any such license issued following January 1 of any year and
expiring on June 30 of each year shall be one-half of that prescribed by this
section.
(Ord. 5170. Passed 5-30-72.)
750.06 LICENSE REVOCATION OR SUSPENSION.
   Upon final conviction of a licensee or of any employee thereof acting within
the scope of his employment, for any violation of this article or a statute of
the State relating to the regulation and control of alcoholic liquors,
gambling, prostitution or the sale, possession or distribution of narcotics or
dangerous drugs, before the Police Court of the City or any court of record,
the City Licensing Officer shall forthwith revoke the license of such licensee.
Upon the revocation of a license issued by the West Virginia Alcohol Beverage
Control Commissioner to a licensee under this article, the City Licensing
Officer shall forthwith revoke the license issued under this article. Whenever
the City Licensing Officer shall suspend or revoke a license he shall give
written notice of such suspension or revocation to a licensee by certified
mail, return receipt requested, or may cause such notice to be served in person
on the licensee.
(Ord. 3492. Passed 7-25-67.)
750.99 VIOLATIONS AND PENALTIES.
   No licensee, agent, employee or member thereof on the licensee's premises
shall perform, authorize or permit any of the acts specified as unlawful in
West Virginia Code 60-7- 12. No licensee, agent, employee or member thereof on
such licensee's premises shall violate any of the rules and regulations legally
issued by the West Virginia Alcohol Beverage Control Commissioner. Any person
who violates the provisions of such statute or any of such rules and
regulation, shall violate the provisions of this article and shall be fined not
less than fifty dollars ($50.00) nor more than five hundred dollars ($500.00),
or imprisoned for not more than thirty days, or both.
(Ord. 3453. Passed 4-11-67.)
ARTICLE 753
Professional Bondsmen
753.01      Definition.
753.02      License required.
753.03     License fee.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
Professional bondsmen in criminal cases - see W. Va. Code 51-10-1 et seq.
 
753.01 DEFINITION.
   A "professional bondsman" shall be deemed to be a person who, for
consideration, becomes surety or provides surety on any bail bond, recognizance
bond, appeal bond or other court bond required to be filed in any court;
provided, however, that nothing in this article shall be construed to apply to
any firm or corporation doing business as a surety company and duly licensed
under the laws of the State.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
753.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   An annual license is required in order to engage in or carry on the business
of professional bondsman.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
753.03 LICENSE FEE.
   The license fee to engage in or carry on the business of professional
bondsman shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00).
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
ARTICLE 755
Real Estate Brokers
755.01      Definition.
755.02      License required.
755.03     License fee.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
State law provisions - see W. Va. Code 47-12-1 et seq.
 
755.01 DEFINITION.
   The term "real estate broker" as used in this article means any person who,
for compensation or consideration, sells, buys, negotiates the purchase or
sale, exchanges, leases, rents, or manages any real estate or any improvement
on real estate, or who offers, advertises, or holds himself out to do any of
such things for another or others.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
755.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   An annual license is required in order to act as a real estate broker.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
755.03 LICENSE FEE.
   The license fee to act as a real estate broker in the City shall be fifty
dollars ($50.00)
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
ARTICLE 757
Special Sales
757.01      Definitions.
757.02      License issuance; fees.
757.03     Application requirements.
757.04     Duties of licensee.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
State law provisions - see W. Va. Code 47-11B
Auctions - see B.R.&T. Art.
711
Stores - see B.R.&T. Art.
763
Privilege taxes - see B.R.&T. Art.
787
 
757.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this article:
   (a)   "Going-out-of-business sale" means a sale held out in such a manner as
to reasonably cause the public to believe that upon the disposal of the stock
of goods on hand the business will cease and be discontinued, including but not
limited to the following sales: adjuster's; adjustment; alteration; assignee's;
bankrupt; benefit of administrators; benefit of creditors; benefit of trustees;
building coming down; closing; creditor's committee; creditor's; end;
executor's; final days; forced out; forced-out-of-business; insolvents'; last
days; lease expires; liquidation; loss of lease; mortgage sale; receiver's;
trustee's; quitting business.
   (b)   "Removal of business sale" means a sale held out in such a manner as
to reasonably cause the public to believe that the person conducting the sale
will cease and discontinue business at the place of sale upon disposal of the
stock of goods on hand and will then move to and resume business at a new
location in the City or will then continue business from other existing
locations in the City.
   (c)   "Fire and other altered goods sale" means a sale held out in such a
manner as to reasonably cause the public to believe that the sale will offer
goods damaged or altered by fire, smoke, water or other means. (Ord. 2564.
Passed 6-3-58.)
757.02 LICENSE ISSUANCE; FEES.
   No person shall sell or offer to sell any goods at a sale to be advertised,
represented or held out by any means to be a going-out-of-business sale,
removal of business sale, or fire and other altered stock sale without first
making written application to the Licensing Officer as required in Section
757.03 and obtaining the required license therefor. The license fee to conduct
a going-out-of-business sale, removal of business sale, or fire and other
altered stock sale shall be twenty-five dollars ($25.00). The license fee for a
renewal of a license to hold such sale shall be ten dollars ($10.00). A license
shall authorize the sale described in the application for a period of not more
than thirty consecutive days, Sundays and legal holidays excluded, following
the issuance thereof. A renewal license shall be issued for one period of time
only, such period to be in addition to that permitted under the original
license and not to exceed thirty consecutive days, Sundays and holidays
excluded, when the licensee has filed a written application for a renewal,
submitted a revised inventory showing the items listed on the original
inventory remaining unsold and when the licensing officer shall find that facts
exist justifying a renewal of license. No person who has held a sale, regulated
hereunder, at the location stated in the application, within the period of one
year preceding an application for license shall be granted a license. Where a
person applying for a license operates more than one place of business the
license issued shall apply only to one store or branch specified in the
application and no other store or branch shall advertise or represent that it
is cooperating with or in any way participating in the licensed sale, nor shall
the store or branch conducting the licensed sale advertise or represent that
any other store or branch is cooperating with it or participating in any way in
the licensed sale.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
757.03 APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS.
   A person desiring to conduct a going-out-of-business sale, removal of
business sale, and fire and other altered goods sale shall make a written
application to the Licensing Officer setting forth and containing the following
information:
   (a)   The true name and address of the owner of the goods to be the object
of the sale;
   (b)   The true name and address of the person from whom he purchased the
goods to be sold and the price therefor, and if not purchased, the manner of
such acquisition;
   (c)   A description of the place where such sale is to be held;
   (d)   The nature of the occupancy, whether by lease or sublease and the
effective date of termination of such occupancy;
   (e)   The dates of the period of time in which the sale is to be conducted;
   (f)   A full and complete statement of the facts in regard to the sale,
including the reason for the urgent and expeditious disposal of goods thereby
and the manner in which the sale will be conducted;
   (g)   The means to be employed in advertising such sale together with the
proposed content of any advertisement;
   (h)   A complete and detailed inventory of the goods to be sold at such sale
as disclosed by the applicant's records. The inventory shall be attached to and
become part of the required application.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
757.04 DUTIES OF LICENSEE.
   A licensee under Section
757.02 shall:
   (a)   Make no additions whatsoever, during the period of the licensed sale,
to the stock of goods set forth in the inventory attached to the application
for license.
   (b)   Refrain from employing any untrue, deceptive or misleading
advertising.
   (c)   Conduct the licensed sale in strict conformity with any advertising or
holding out incident thereto.
   (d)   Keep available at the place of sale a duplicate copy of the inventory
submitted with the application and shall present such duplicate to inspecting
officials upon request.
   (e)   Keep any other goods separate and apart from the goods listed in the
filed inventory as being objects of sale and shall make such distinction clear
to the public by placing tags on all inventoried goods in and about the place
of sale apprising the public of the status of all such goods.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3- 58.)
ARTICLE 759
Slot Machines and Automatic Devices
759.01      Definition.
759.02      License fee.
759.03      Number registered; decalcomania stamp.
759.04      Coin-operated laundries and auto wash devices; license fee.
759.05     Betting or wagering.
759.06     Play by minors prohibited; duty to post signs.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
Gambling - see GEN. OFF. Art.
513
 
759.01 DEFINITION.
   The term "slot machine" when used in this article shall not be deemed to
include any pay telephone or postage stamp vending machine operated on the
coin-in-the-slot principle.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
759.02 LICENSE FEE.
   (a)   The annual license fee to keep or maintain an automatic baggage or
parcel checking machine or device which is used for the storage of baggage or
parcels of any character, shall be fifty cents (50¢) for each section of any
such device which is operated on the coin-in-the-slot principle.
   (b)   The annual license fee to keep or maintain any automatic toilet locker
or device shall be fifty cents (50¢) for every such locker or device.
   (c)   The annual license fee to own and operate a total of twenty or more
coin- operated merchandise or service devices of the following types shall be:
one cent ($.01) devices - fifty dollars ($50.00); five cent ($.05) devices -
one hundred dollars ($100.00); ten cent ($.10) devices - one hundred fifty
dollars ($150.00); over ten cent ($.10) devices - two hundred fifty dollars
($250.00). The operator of more than one type of such device shall pay the
highest fee prescribed. The license fee to own and operate less than twenty
merchandise or service devices shall be upon a per device basis as follows: one
cent ($.01) devices - two dollars ($2.00); five cent ($.05) devices - five
dollars ($5.00); ten cent ($.10) devices - ten dollars ($10.00); over ten cent
($.10) devices - twelve dollars and fifty cents ($12.50). Any device taking
more than one denomination of coin shall be licensed on the basis of the
largest denomination of coin taken or the total of the coins necessary to make
the device function or operate. (A.O.)
   (d)   The annual license fee to keep or maintain any other automatic slot
machine or device, except those machines commonly referred to as video slot
machines, video poker machines, and similar amusement devices, which is not a
gambling device under the laws of the State, shall be at the rate of ten
dollars ($10.00) for each such machine or device kept or maintained by the
licensee.
   (e)   The annual license fee to keep or maintain an automatic slot machine
or device, commonly referred to as a video slot machine, video poker machine,
or similar amusement device, shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00) for each
such machine or device kept or maintained by the licensee.
(Ord. 11907. Passed 10-5-99.)
759.03 NUMBER REGISTERED; DECALCOMANIA STAMP.
   (a)   Application for licenses required under Section
759.02(c) shall contain the necessary information for proper license under the
fee schedule therein for machines that are owned and operated on location by
the licensee within the City during the ensuing license year or any part
thereof. Each vending machine operator shall make application to the City
Treasurer on forms provided by him, and shall furnish such information as may
be required, provided that vending machine operators operating twenty or more
machines are only required to furnish a certified statement as to the total
number of machines on location in the City, and the applicant shall be subject
to the penalties of false swearing for any untrue statement contained in his
application. The provisions of any applicable West Virginia law applying to
ownership, identification, the keeping of records and reports, and availability
for inspection, shall have full application to the licensing of such machines
in this City.
(Ord. 3341. Passed 3-29-66.)
   (b)   Application for the licenses required by this article, under Section
759.02(d), shall contain the number of such machines or devices to be kept or
maintained by the licensee within the City during the ensuing license year.
Application for the licenses required under Section
759.02(e) shall include the number of such machines or devices together with
the serial number and location of each such machine or device. Such information
shall be supplemented and provided to the City at least on a quarterly basis to
reflect any changes in the number, serial number, or location of such machines
or devices. One license certificate shall be issued to each person keeping or
maintaining such machines or devices as aforesaid, but the City Licensing
Officer shall issue to any such licensee a decalcomania stamp or other evidence
of license for each such machine or device, which decalcomania stamp or other
evidence of license shall be securely attached to the side or front of each
such machine or device, properly protected and plainly visible. Each such
machine or device shall also bear on the side or front thereof, so as to be
plainly visible, the name and address of the person keeping or maintaining such
machine or device.
   The proprietor or owner of the business conducted in the place where such
machine is kept or maintained is charged with the responsibility of satisfying
himself that such decalcomania stamp or other evidence of license is so
attached before permitting its installation in his place of business, and in
the event the owner of any automatic machine or device refuses, neglects or
fails to pay the license fee due upon such machine or device, the proprietor or
owner of the business conducted in the place where such machine or device is
installed, operated or maintained shall be liable for the payment of such
license fee.
(Ord. 3341. Passed 3-29-66; Ord. 11907. Passed 10-5-99.)
759.04 COIN-OPERATED LAUNDRIES AND AUTO WASH DEVICES; LICENSE FEE.
   Coin-operated devices which wash, dry, clean or dry clean items of any
description, including clothing, household items, automotive vehicles or boats,
or dispense merchandise for use in such washing, drying, cleaning or dry
cleaning, are hereby subject to a license tax.
   All persons owning the aforementioned devices, or like washing devices,
shall be liable for payment of such license tax. Ownership shall be deemed
established by determining who is the purchaser by either a bill of sale, paid
invoice or a conditional sales contract or agreement filed and recorded in the
applicable County Clerk's Office in this State or in the office of the
Secretary of State. Leasing of machines will not be deemed a transfer of
ownership.
   The annual license fee to own machines being operated in this State and
whether operated by the owner or other persons shall be as follows: upon ten
more machines, in any one location, the annual license fee shall be thirty
dollars ($30.00). Upon less than ten machines, in any one location, the annual
license fee shall be three dollars ($3.00) for each machine, provided that in
no instance shall the annual license fee be less than fifteen dollars ($15.00).
   Application for the license required herein shall be made upon forms
provided by the City Licensing Officer, and the applicant shall furnish such
information as may be required by such Officer. The completed application shall
be subscribed and sworn to before a Notary Public.
   It is hereby provided that no machine or device licensed under the
provisions of this section shall be subject to the license fees imposed by
Section
759.02.
(Ord. 3473. Passed 6-20-67.)
759.05 BETTING OR WAGERING.
   No owner or proprietor of the business conducted in the place where
automatic slot machines or devices are kept or maintained, his servants, agents
or employees, shall bet or wager anything of value in any manner upon any game
played upon any such automatic slot machine or device, or allow or permit any
person to bet or wager anything of value in any manner upon any game played
upon any such machine or device; provided, however, that this section shall not
apply to any such machine or device properly licensed and/or regulated by any
applicable state agency.
(Ord. 11907. Passed 10-5-99.)
759.06 PLAY BY MINORS PROHIBITED; DUTY TO POST SIGNS.
   No owner or proprietor of the business conducted in the place where
automatic slot machines or devices are kept, or maintained, his servants,
agents or employees, shall allow or permit any person under the age of eighteen
years to play any video slot machine, video poker machine, or any similar or
like device.
   It shall be the duty of the owner or proprietor of such business to post
conspicuously on each such video slot machine, video poker machine, or similar
device the following sign: “Play of this machine by minors under the age of
eighteen (18) years prohibited by law”.
(Ord. 11907. Passed 10-5-99.)
ARTICLE 761
Small Loan Businesses
761.01      License required.
761.02     License fee.
 
CROSS REFERENCE

therefor than six percent (6%).
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
761.02 LICENSE FEE.
   The license fee shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00)
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
ARTICLE 762
Solicitation of Funds
762.01      Definition.
762.02      Permission from City Manager required.
762.03      Applications for permission.
762.04      Statements to be filed by applicants.
762.05      Granting of permission; duration.
762.06     Procedure where days requested for solicitations conflict.
762.07     False statements to procure permission.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Charitable solicitations - see W. Va. Code Art. 29-19
Trespass - see GEN. OFF.
533.02
Hawkers and peddlers - see B.R.&T. Art.
727
Itinert vendors - see B.R.&T. Art.
733
 
762.01 DEFINITION.
   "Public solicitation for funds" shall specifically include "tag" days,
"poppy" and "forget-me-not" sales and any other solicitation carried on in a
similar manner, and shall mean any and all forms or methods of collecting funds
or public contributions.
(1961 Code Sec. 531.01)
762.02 PERMISSION FROM CITY MANAGER REQUIRED.
   No person, group of persons, firm, corporation, club, organization,
association or institution, or the agent of such firm, corporation, club,
organization, association or institution, shall make or conduct any public
solicitation for funds on the streets of the City without first making written
application to the City Manager and receiving written permission from the City
Manager to make or conduct such public solicitation.
(1961 Code Sec. 531.02)
762.03 APPLICATIONS FOR PERMISSION.
   Any application presented to the City Manager for permission to make or
conduct a public solicitation shall be presented at least ten days before the
proposed date of the solicitation, and shall state:
   (a)   The name of the person, group of persons, firm, corporation, club,
organization, association or institution, making the application;
   (b)   The names and addresses of the officers of the applicant, if there are
officers, or three responsible persons affiliated with the applicant;
   (c)   The purpose for which the funds are to be collected and the use that
is to be made of them;
   (d)   The names and addresses of all persons who will be active or otherwise
take part in the solicitation;
   (e)   The proposed time of the solicitation; and
   (f)   The manner in which the solicitation is to be made.
      (1961 Code Sec. 531.03)
762.04 STATEMENTS TO BE FILED BY APPLICANTS.
   Before granting permission to any applicant to make or conduct such a public
solicitation, the City Manager shall require every applicant to file in his
office a statement or affidavit, signed by an officer of the applicant, or some
other responsible person satisfactory to the City Manager, stating what
percentage of the funds collected by such public solicitation are to remain and
be used in the City and the percentage of funds collected which are to go
elsewhere, the name of the organization which will receive them and the use to
which they will be put, and that no persons who are not bona-fide residents of
the City will take any part in the public solicitation of funds. The City
Manager may also require the applicant to present to him such other information
as he, in his judgment, shall deem advisable.
(1961 Code Sec. 531.04)
762.05 GRANTING OF PERMISSION; DURATION.
   When and if the City Manager is satisfied that the applicant is responsible,
that the proposed public solicitation will be properly conducted by bona-fide
residents of the City and that all funds raised by such solicitation are to
remain and be used in the City, or that the proportion of the funds collected
which are to go outside of the City is proper, that the organization receiving
them is a nationally recognized organization, and that the use to be made of
such funds is a proper use, he shall give written permission to the applicant
to make the public solicitation. Such permission shall definitely state the
period of time during which the applicant is to be permitted to make or conduct
its solicitation. (1961 Code Sec. 531.05)
762.06 PROCEDURE WHERE DAYS REQUESTED FOR SOLICITATIONS CONFLICT.
   In the event there should be more than one application made to the City
Manager requesting permission to conduct public solicitation on the same day,
the City Manager shall seek to have all applicants except one voluntarily
change the time requested, giving special consideration to national
organizations which hold a nationwide appeal on a particular day. If no
agreement can be reached among the applicants, and they insist on pressing
their applications for an identical day, the City Manager shall give written
permission to the organization first filing the application in his office.
(1961 Code Sec. 531.06)
762.07 FALSE STATEMENTS TO PROCURE PERMISSION.
   No person knowingly shall make any false statement in order to procure
permission from the City Manager to make or conduct any public solicitation.
(1961 Code Sec. 531.07)
ARTICLE 763
Stores
763.01      Definitions.
763.02      License requried.
763.03      Annual license fee.
763.04      Exemptions.
763.05      Application for license; filing fee.
763.06     Return of application for correction; granting and display of
license.
763.07     License not transferable.
763.08     Change of location of store.
763.09     Expiration and renewal of license.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Trading stamps - see B.R.&T. Art.
769
Merchants' duty to keep sidewalks free of litter - see H.& S.
1103.05
 
763.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this article:
   (a)   "Person" includes any group or combination acting as a unit,
individual, committee, guardian, trustee, executor, administrator, partnership,
copartnership, joint adverture, association, trust, firm or corporation, either
domestic or foreign, which is controlled or held with others by majority stock
ownership or ultimately controlled or directed by one management or association
of ultimate management.
   (b)   "Special store" includes any store or any mercantile establishment in
which goods, wares or merchandise of any kind except cigarettes, tobacco
products and soft drinks are purchased, ordered, sold or offered for sale,
either at retail or wholesale, and which contains no coin-operated device owned
and operated by the store proprietor.
   (c)   "General store" includes any store or any mercentile establishment in
which goods, wares or merchandise of any kind are purchased, ordered, sold or
offered for sale either at retail or wholesale.
   For the purpose of this article, no coin-operated device shall be construed
to be a store.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
763.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall establish, operate or maintain any store in the City without
first having obtained a license to do so from the City Licensing Officer as
hereinafter provided.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
763.03 ANNUAL LICENSE FEE.
   Every person establishing, operating or maintaining one or more special
stores within the City shall pay an annual license fee of five dollars ($5.00)
for each special store.
   Every person establishing, operating or maintaining one or more general
stores within the City shall pay an annual license fee of fifteen dollars
($15.00) for each general store.
   Each license issued for a special store or general store prior to January 1,
of any year shall be charged for at the full rate and each license issued on or
after January 1 shall be charged for at one-half of the full rate, as
prescribed in this section.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3- 58.)
763.04 EXEMPTIONS.
   The establishment, operation or maintenance of stores by the following shall
be exempt from the license fee imposed by this article:
   (a)   The United States of America; the State of West Virginia and its
political subdivisions;
   (b)   Religious and charitable organizations;
   (c)   Any person or persons engaged within the City in the business of
producing agricultural products who, individually or collectively, sell in such
store only agricultural products which he or they have produced. (Ord. 2564.
Passed 6-3- 58.)
763.05 APPLICATION FOR LICENSE; FILING FEE.
   Any person desiring to establish, operate or maintain a store in the City
shall apply to the City Licensing Officer for a license to do so. The
application for a license shall be made on the form which shall be prescribed
and furnished by the City Licensing Officer and shall set forth the name and
address of the applicant, the name and location of such store and such other
facts as the City Licensing Officer may require. If the applicant desires to
operate more than one such store, he shall make a separate application for each
such store. Each such application shall be accompanied by a filing fee of fifty
cents (50¢) for each license requested, and by the license fee prescribed in
Section
763.03.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
763.06 RETURN OF APPLICATION FOR CORRECTION; GRANTING AND DISPLAY OF LICENSE.
   As soon as practicable after the receipt of any such application, the City
Licensing Officer shall carefully examine such application to ascertain whether
it is in proper form and contains the necessary and requisite information. If,
upon examination, the City Licensing Officer shall find that any such
application is not in proper form and does not contain the necessary and
requisite information, he shall return such application for correction. If an
application is found to be satisfactory, and if the filing fee and license fee,
as herein prescribed, shall have been paid, the City Licensing Officer shall
issue to the applicant a license for each store for which an application for
license shall have been made. Each licensee shall display the license so issued
in a conspicuous place in the store for which such license is issued.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
763.07 LICENSE NOT TRANSFERABLE.
   The special store license and general store license imposed herein shall not
be assignable and shall not be transferable.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
763.08 CHANGE OF LOCATION OF STORE.
   Licenses issued under the foregoing provisions may be altered so as to
permit removal of the store to another location. In order to be effective at
the new location, however, the certificate of license must show upon its face
an endorsement of the change by the City Licensing Officer.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
763.09 EXPIRATION AND RENEWAL OF LICENSE.
   All licenses shall be so issued as to expire on June 30 of each year. On or
before July 1 of each year, every person having a license shall apply to the
City Licensing Officer for a renewal for the year next ensuing, unless such
person has ceased to operate such store or does not propose to continue
operation of the store during the year next ensuing in which event he shall
notify the City Licensing Officer that he has ceased operation of the store or
that he proposes to cease operation of the store prior to July 1 of the year
next ensuing. All applications for renewal shall be made on the forms
prescribed by the City Licensing Officer. Each application for a renewal shall
be accompanied by a filing fee of fifty cents (50¢) for each license requested
and by the license fee as prescribed in Section
763.03.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6- 3-58.)
ARTICLE 765
Street Photographers and Weighers
765.01      License required.
765.02      License fee.
765.03     Permission for location.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
Photographers - see B.R.&T. Art.
749
 
765.01 LICENSE REQUIRED.

alley, open lot or public space for the purpose of taking pictures, operating a
weighing machine attended by an operator, or like purpose.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
765.02 LICENSE FEE.

ARTICLE 767
Taxicabs
767.01      License required.
767.02      License fee.
767.03      Right to occupy stands.
767.04      Registration of chauffeurs required.
767.05     Registration; fee.
767.06     Registration certificate; posting.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Taxicab certificate of convenience - see W. Va. Code 17-6-3
Taxi stands - see TRAF.
361.09
 
767.01 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   An annual license is required in order to carry on or conduct a taxicab
business or to render a taxicab service.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
767.02 LICENSE FEE.
   The license fee shall be one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00) per year.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
767.03 RIGHT TO OCCUPY STANDS.
   The payment of the fee required by Section
767.02 shall entitle the licensee to occupy a two-car taxi stand on the streets
of the City.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
767.04 REGISTRATION OF CHAUFFEURS REQUIRED.
   No person shall operate a taxicab for hire upon the streets of the City, and
no person who owns or controls a taxicab shall permit it to be so driven,
unless the driver or operator of such taxicab shall have first obtained a
registration certificate issued under the provisions of this article.
(Ord. 3034. Passed 10-1-63.)
767.05 REGISTRATION; FEE.
   The owner or operator of a taxicab business or taxicab service shall
register with the Chief of Police of the City, upon forms provided by the City,
the name, address, color, age, signature, fingerprints and photograph of each
chauffeur now employed by him and shall furnish satisfactory proof that each
such chauffeur is duly licensed by the State. The original registration shall
be completed within thirty days after the passage of this section. Thereafter,
such owner or operator shall register the name, address, color, age, signature,
fingerprints and photograph of each person to be employed by him as a
chauffeur, together with evidence that such person is duly licensed as a
chauffeur by the State, before such owner or operator shall permit such
chaufffeur to drive or operate a taxicab A registration fee of two dollars
($2.00) shall be paid to the City for registration of each driver or chauffeur.

(Ord. 3034. Passed 10-1-63.)
767.06 REGISTRATION CERTIFICATE; POSTING.
   When all registration information required by Section
767.05 has been furnished to the Chief of Police, he shall issue a registration
certificate to the chauffeur which shall bear the name, address, color, age and
photograph of such chauffeur. Every chauffeur of a taxicab shall post his
registration certificate in such place within the taxicab as to be in full view
of all passengers while such chauffeur is operating the taxicab.
(Ord. 3034. Passed 10-1-63.)
