coupon or similar device issued and redeemed by a manufacturer or packer.
ARTICLE 771
Trailer Camps
771.01      Definitions.
771.02      Application for license; fee.
771.03      Inspection and enforcement.
771.04      Camp plan.
771.05      Waste and garbage disposal.
771.06      Permanent and temporary occupancy.
771.07     Location outside camps.
771.08     Permit for location outside of trailer camp.
771.09     Parking permit fee.
771.10     Revocation of license or permit.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate - see W. Va. Code 8-12-5(30)
 
771.01 DEFINITIONS.
   Whenever used in this article, unless a different meaning appears from the
context:
   (a)   "Dependent unit" means a trailer which does not have bathroom or
shower and toilet facilities.
   (b)   "Nondependent unit" means a trailer that has bath or shower and toilet
facilities.
   (c)   "Person" includes an individual, partnership, firm, company,
corporation, whether tenant, owner, lessee, licensee, or the agent, heir or
assign thereof.
   (d)   "Space" means a plot of ground in a trailer camp of not less than
1,000 square feet of space designed for the location for only one automobile
and/or one trailer.
   (e)   "Trailer" means any coach, cabin, mobile home, house car or other
vehicle or structure intended for or capable of human dwelling or sleeping
purposes, mounted upon wheels or supports, and/or capable of being moved by its
own power or transported by another vehicle.
   (f)   "Trailer camp" means any park, court, camp, site, plot, parcel or
tract of land designed, maintained, intended or used for the purpose of
supplying a location or accommodations for more than two trailers and shall
include all buildings used or intended for use as part of the equipment thereof
whether or not a charge is made for the use of the traielr camp and its
facilities. "Trailer camp" shall not include automobile or trailer sales lots
on which unoccupied trailers are parked for purposes of inspection and sale.
   (g)   "Unit" means a trailer unit.
(Ord. 2237. Passed 4-19-55.)
771.02 APPLICATION FOR LICENSE; FEE.
   (a)   No person shall establish, operate or maintain, or permit to be
established, operated or maintained upon any property owned, leased or
controlled by him, a permanent or temporary trailer camp within the City,
without having first secured a license for each such camp from the City
Licensing Officer pursuant to this article. Such license shall expire one year
from the date of issuance but may be renewed under the provisions of this
article for additional periods of one year.
   (b)   The application for such license or the renewal thereof is subject to
approval and shall be filed with the City Licensing Officer (City Manager
pursuant to Charter §39) and shall be accompanied by an annual fee of seven
hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) for each space in the existing or proposed
camp. A fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00) shall be paid for each transfer of
a license.
   (c)    The application for a license or the renewal thereof shall be made on
forms furnished by the Department of Economic and Community Development and
shall include the name and address of the owner in fee of the tract (if the fee
is vested in some person other than the applicant, a duly verified statement by
that person, that the applicant is authorized by him to construct or maintain
the trailer camp and make the application), and such a legal description of the
premises upon which the trailer camp is or will be located as will readily
identify and definitely locate the premises. The application shall be
accompanied by two copies of the camp plan showing the following, either
existing or as proposed:
      (1)   The extent and area used for camp purposes;
      (2)   Roadways and driveways;
      (3)   Location of units for trailers;
      (4)   Location and number of sanitary conveniences, including toilets,
washrooms, laundries and utility rooms to be used by occupant of units;
      (5)   Method and plan of sewage disposal;
      (6)   Method and plan of garbage removal;
      (7)   Plan for water supply;
      (8)   Plan for electrical lighting of units.
       (9)   Location in an existing I-2 General Industrial Zone as identified
on the City's Zoning Map;
      (10)   The camp shall be situated on a parcel of land containing at least
1 acre and useable plot thereon shall measure 1200 square feet;
      (11)   Comply with the flood plain regulations appearing in Article
1351 .
      (12)   For temporary camps, a site restoration plan detailing how the
property will resort back to the previous conditions upon expiration of license
and/or denial of renewal.
   If the existing or proposed camp is designed to serve nondependent trailer
units, such plans shall clearly set forth the location of all sewer and water
pipes and connections.
(Ord. 14330. Passed 7-3-12.)
771.03 INSPECTION AND ENFORCEMENT.
   No trailer camp license, or permit for location outside of a licensed
trailer camp, shall be issued until the City Licensing Officer shall notify the
Chief of Police, Health Officer, Chief of the Fire Department and Building
Inspector or their authorized agents of such application, and these officials
shall inspect or cause to be inspected each application and the premises to
determine whether the applicant and the premises on which trailers will be
located comply with the regulations, ordinances and laws applicable thereto.
These officials shall furnish to the Health Officer in writing the information
derived from such investigation, and a statement as to whether the applicant
and the premises meet the requirements of the department for whom the officer
is certifying. No license shall be renewed without a reinspection of the
premises. For the purpose of making inspections and securing enforcement such
officials or their authorized agents shall have the right and are empowered to
enter on any premises on which a trailer is located, or about to be located,
and to inspect the same and all accommodations connected therewith at any
reasonable time.
(Ord. 2237. Passed 4-19-55.)
771.04 CAMP PLAN.
   (a)   Every trailer or trailer camp shall be located on a well drained area,
and the premises shall be properly graded so as to prevent the accumulation of
storm or other waters. No trailer or trailer camp shall be located in any area
that is situated so that drainage from any barnyard, outdoor toilet or other
source of filth can be deposited in its location.
   (b)   Every trailer camp shall provide electric service, water and toilet
facilities for its occupants.
(Ord. 2237. Passed 4-19-55.)
771.05 WASTE AND GARBAGE DISPOSAL.
   (a)   All liquid waste from showers, toilets, launderies, faucets,
lavatories, etc., shall be discharged into a sewer system extended from and
connect with the public sewer system.
   (b)   Every trailer unit shall provide garbage disposal facilities for its
occupants.
(Ord. 2237. Passed 4-19-55.)
771.06 PERMANENT AND TEMPORARY OCCUPANCY.
   No trailer shall be used at any place within the City as a permanent place
of abode or as a permanent dwelling, except in a regularly established and
licensed trailer camp. A trailer may be used as a temporary abode or dwelling
place if the special permit provided for in Section
771.08 is first obtained. Every such special permit shall be issued for a
definite period of time.
(Ord. 3332. Passed 3-15-66.)
771.07 LOCATION OUTSIDE CAMPS.
   (a)   Except as provided in this article, no person shall park any trailer
on any street, alley, or highway, or other public place, or on any tract of
land owned by any person, within the City.
 
   (b)   Emergency or temporary stopping or parking is permitted on any street,
alley or highway for not longer than one hour subject to any other and further
prohibitions, regulations, or limitations imposed by the traffic and parking
regulations or ordinances for that street, alley or highway.
 
   (c)   No person shall park or occupy any trailer on any premises which is
situated outside an approved trailer camp, except under special permit as
provided in Section
771.08. The parking of only one unoccupied trailer in an accessory private
garage building, or in a rear yard, is permitted providing no living quarters
shall be maintained or any business practiced in the trailer while such trailer
is so parked or stored.
(Ord. 2237. Passed 4-19-55.)
771.08 PERMIT FOR LOCATION OUTSIDE OF TRAILER CAMP.
   (a)   The Health Officer may issue special written permits allowing the
location of a trailer outside of a trailer camp. The person to whom such permit
is granted shall be subject to the parking permit fee. The permit shall be
granted only upon the written consent of the owner, legal agent of the owner or
the lessee of the location for which the permit is issued.
   (b)   Application for the permit shall be made to the City-County Health
Department and shall be accompanied by an inspection fee of five dollars
($5.00), and shall state the names and permanent addresses of the occupants of
the trailer, the license number of their trailer and towing vehicle, place of
last stay, intended purpose of stay at requested location, whether the
occupants are nonresident tourists, whether any occupant is employed in this
State; the exact location of the premises, the name of the owner and the
occupant of any dwelling on the premises, and the owner's and/or occupant's
permission to locate; a statement of the nature and location of sanitary
facilities and the permission of the occupant of the dwelling house for their
use; and a statement that all wastes from trailer occupancy will be disposed of
in a sanitary manner. Application for location on a vacant lot or parcel of
land shall be accompanied by a statement of the nature and location of sanitary
facilities, which must include a safe water supply and toilet within 200 feet
of the proposed location of the trailer; and a statement of permission from the
owner for their use.
   (c)   All occupants of any trailer located outside of a trailer camp shall
register with the City-County Health Department. All provisions of this article
governing the location, use and sanitation of trailers located in a licensed
trailer camp shall, so far as they are applicable, apply to any trailer located
outside of such trailer camp.
(Ord. 2237. Passed 4-19-55.)
771.09 PARKING PERMIT FEE.
   Occupants of trailers parked outside of a licensed camp shall pay an annual
permit fee of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) to the City Treasurer.
(Ord. 2237. Passed 4-19-55.)
771.10 REVOCATION OF LICENSE OR PERMIT.
   Any license or permit issued under provisions of this article may be revoked
by the City for noncompliance with the provisions of this article.
(Ord. 2237. Passed 4-19-55.)
ARTICLE 773
Warehouses
773.01      License required.
773.02     License fee.
 
773.01 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   An annual license is required for conducting the business of operating and
maintaining a warehouse.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
773.02 LICENSE FEE.
   The license fee for conducting the business of operating and maintaining a
warehouse shall be twenty-five dollars ($25.00). No license hereunder shall be
issued without the prior certification of the Fire Chief and the City Engineer.

(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
ARTICLE 777
Window or House Cleaners
777.01      License required.
777.02     License fee.
 
777.01 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   An annual license is required to carry on or conduct the business of washing
or cleaning windows, or cleaning houses or the interior of houses or other
buildings. (Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
777.02 LICENSE FEE.
   The license fee to carry on or conduct the business of washing or cleaning
windows, or cleaning houses or the interior of houses or other buildings, shall
be as follows: five dollars ($5.00) if not more than five persons be regularly
employed for such purposes; ten dollars ($10.00) if not less than six or more
than ten persons be regularly employed for such purposes; and fifteen dollars
($15.00) if more than ten persons be regularly employed for such purposes.
(Ord. 2564. Passed 6-3-58.)
ARTICLE 778
Wine Dealers
778.01      Definitions.
778.02      City license issuance.
778.03      Licenses; general restrictions.
778.04      License fees.
778.05      Transfer of license.
778.06      When retail sales prohibited.
778.07      Persons to whom sales prohibited.
778.08      Sales on credit prohibited; exception.
778.09     When distribution to retailers prohibited.
778.10     Acquisition from licensed distributors only.
778.11     Sale of wine in sealed packages.
778.12     Conduct on premises.
778.13     Report of violations.
778.99     Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Sale of wines - see W. Va. Code Art. 60-8
Liquor control - see GEN. OFF. Art.
521
Sales tax - see B.R.&T. Art.
785
 
778.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purposes of this article, the words "distributor", "retailer",
"licensee", "grocery store", "wine specialty shop", and "wine" shall have the
meanings as defined by the statutes of the State of West Virginia.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.02 CITY LICENSE ISSUANCE.
   The Licensing Officer shall issue a City license under this article upon the
issuance of a State license and the payment of the City license fee.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.03 LICENSES; GENERAL RESTRICTIONS.
   (a)   No person may engage in business in the capacity of a wine distributor
or retailer within the City without first obtaining a license from the
Licensing Officer, nor shall a person continue to engage in any such activity
after his license has expired, been suspended or revoked. No person may be
licensed in more than one of such capacities at the same time.
   (b)   No retailer may be licensed as a private club or as a class A retail
dealer in nonintoxicating beer. A retailer who has more than one place of
retail business shall obtain a license for each separate retail establishment.
A retailer's license may be issued only to the proprietor or owner of a bona-
fide grocery store or wine specialty shop and shall only be valid for the
retail sale of wine at the specified grocery store or wine specialty shop.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.04 LICENSE FEES.
   The Licensing Officer shall collect an annual fee for licenses issued under
this article as follows:
   (a)   Distributor. In the case of a distributor, the license fee shall be
two thousand five hundred dollars ($2,500) per year.
   (b)   Retailer. In the case of a retailer, the license fee shall be one
hundred fifty dollars ($150.00) per year.
   The license period shall begin on July 1 of each year and end on June 30 of
the following year. If the initial license is granted for less than a year, the
fee shall be prorated according to the number of quarters remaining in the
fiscal year, including the quarter in which application is made.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.05 TRANSFER OF LICENSE.
   No license issued under this article may be transferred to another person,
but the location of the premises to which the license applies may be changed
when the following requirements are met:
   (a)   Advance notice of the intention to transfer or change the location
shall have been made in writing to the Licensing Officer; and
   (b)   The written consent of the State Alcohol Beverage Control Commissioner
for the proposed change has been exhibited to the Licensing Officer.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.06 WHEN RETAIL SALES PROHIBITED.
   No retailer, his servants, agents or employees shall sell or deliver wine on
any general or primary election day, or prior to 1:00 p.m. or after 9:00 p.m.
on Sundays, or between the hours of 9:00 p.m. and 10:00 a.m. on weekdays and
Saturdays.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.07 PERSONS TO WHOM SALES PROHIBITED.
   No licensee, his servants, agents or employees shall sell, furnish or give
wine to any minor, mental incompetent, or person who is phsyically
incapacitated due to the consumption of alcoholic liquor or the use of drugs.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.08 SALES ON CREDIT PROHIBITED; EXCEPTION.
   No distributor shall sell or offer to sell, nor shall any retailer purchase
or receive, any wine except on a cash basis. No right of action shall exist to
collect any claims for credit extended contrary to the provisions of this
section. Provided, however, that nothing herein contained shall prohibit, as a
credit on any subsequent sale, the crediting of the purchase price charged for
wine returned by the purchaser because of damage, spoilage, erroneous shipment
or orders, and other such reasons customary in the trade.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.09 WHEN DISTRIBUTION TO RETAILERS PROHIBITED.
   No distributor, his agents, servants or employees shall transport or deliver
wine to any licensee on Sunday or any general election day.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.10 ACQUISITION FROM LICENSED DISTRIBUTORS ONLY.
   No retail licensee shall sell, furnish or dispense any wine purchased or
acquired from any source other than a distributor who has obtained a license
from both the State and the City.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.11 SALE OF WINE IN SEALED PACKAGES.
   All wines sold pursuant to this article shall be sold only in their original
sealed packages.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.12 CONDUCT ON PREMISES.
   No person while on the premises of any retailer licensed under this article
shall perform, nor shall any such retailer, his servants, agents or employees
permit any of the following activities:
   (a)   Breaking of the seal on any package or bottle of wine.
   (b)   Consumption of any alcoholic liquor, wine or beer.
   (c)   Loitering.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.13 REPORT OF VIOLATIONS.
   Every violation of any of the provisions of this article shall be reported
to the State Alcohol Beverage Control Commission.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
778.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this article or makes any false statement
concerning any material fact in submitting application for license or for a
renewal of a license or in any hearing concerning the suspension or revocation
thereof, or who commits any of the acts herein declared to be unlawful, shall
for each offense be fined not less than twenty-five dollars ($25.00) nor more
than five hundred dollars ($500.00), or imprisoned not more than thirty days,
or both.
(Ord. 7254. Passed 5-12-81.)
ARTICLE 779
Yard or Garage Sales
779.01     Definition.
779.02     Limitations on garage or yard sales.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Advertising - see GEN. OFF. Art
503
Special tools - see B.R.& T. Art.
757
Littering - see H.& S. Art.
1103
 
779.01 DEFINITION.
   For the purposes of this article the term "garage or yard sale" means a sale
held out in such a manner as reasonably to cause the public to believe that the
sale will offer used goods not purchased for the purpose of resale. This
article shall not apply to sales by charitable organizations held indoors.
(Ord. 6012. Passed 7-20-76.)
779.02 LIMITATIONS ON GARAGE OR YARD SALES.
   No person shall hold a garage sale or yard sale:
   (a)   That offers for sale goods which were purchased for the purpose of
resale;
   (b)   That obstructs or causes to be obstructed City sidewalks or streets;
   (c)   Lasting longer than three successive days; or
   (d)   Unless one year has elapsed from the last garage or yard sale held by
such person.
(Ord. 6012. Passed 7-20-76.)
ARTICLE 780
Street Vendors
780.01   Definitions.
780.02   Penalties.
780.03   Scope of article.
780.04   Categories for street vending.
780.05   Street sales.
780.06   Compliance with guidelines.
780.07   Licensing; operation without license unlawful; failure to display
license unlawful.
780.08   License fees.
780.09   Application and issuance of vendor’s license; general liability
insurance required; procedures.
780.10   Revocation.
780.11   Appeal of revocation.
780.01 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article,
shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the
context clearly indicates a different meaning:
   (b)   Vending is permitted in any non-residentially zoned districts as
established by the Municipal Planning and Zoning Code as well as within a two-
hundred-foot (200) radius of City parks and recreation areas. However, vending
in Wheeling and Oglebay Parks is excluded. Permission to utilize a parking
space, whether metered or otherwise, must be granted by the City Manager in
accord with the provisions of this article. There is, however, no such vending
permitted within a two-hundred-(200) foot radius of the WesBanco Arena, the
Capitol Theater, or the Centre Market during events, nor within a two hundred
(200) foot radius of any privately sponsored fair, festival, event, or within a
one hundred (100) foot radius of an establishment located upon real property
which provides a similar product as that being offered by the Vendor. (E.G.:
food, beverage, wares, etc.). The City Manager and or the Assistant City
Manager may, at his or her discretion, assign vendor positions within areas
located in the Central Business district, herein described to include 10th to
16th Streets from Water Street to Chapline Street and the Center Market
District herein described to include 20th to 23rd Streets from Main Street to
Market Street. Nothing in this article limits vending on private property,
however the necessary provisions applying to licensure, cost, cleanliness,
hours of operation, etc., as contained in this article must be adhered to by
such vendors.
   (c)   Street Vendor means and includes any person, except itinerant vendors,
who engages in or conducts, either as principal or agent, a business selling
goods, wares, merchandise, food, confectionery or drink upon any street,
sidewalk or public part and includes food trucks. (Ord. 15406. Passed 5-5-20.)
 780.02 PENALTIES.
   In addition to any penalties or sanctions provided in this article, the
violation of any requirement of this article shall constitute an offense
punishable in municipal court with a civil penalty for violation and a fine not
to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00) for each such offense. (Ord. 15406.
Passed 5-5-20.)
780.03  SCOPE OF ARTICLE.
   The provisions of this article shall not apply to:
   (a)   Sales governed by other sections of this chapter or sales made to
dealers by commercial travelers or selling agents in the usual course of
business;
   (b)   Bona fide sales of goods, wares or merchandise by samples for future
delivery;
   (c)   Sales at trade shows or conventions, expos, arts and crafts fairs, and
other similar events, or sales by entities at events at WesBanco Arena, sales
by entities at events hosted by a non-profit or political subdivision or sales
held in conjunction with privately sponsored events, fairs or festivals.
   (d)   Special sidewalk sales, festivals or other special events allowed by
special permit or ordinance; or
   (e)   Any City-sponsored event.
      (Ord. 15406. Passed 5-5-20.)
780.04  CATEGORIES FOR STREET VENDING.
   The types of businesses or activities that are permitted in the central
vending district shall be defined by the following classifications:
   (a)   Classification A: All non-food items such as t-shirts, sweatshirts,
arts/crafts, flowers, and any miscellaneous items that are not food products.
   (b)   Classification B: All food products that do not require cooking, such
as fruits, vegetables and non-perishable food items that are pre-packaged by
the manufacturer.
   (c)   Classification C: All food products that require cooking or heating or
a health permit. (Ord. 15406. Passed 5-5-20.)
780.05 STREET SALES.
    (a)   No person licensed as a vendor shall demonstrate, sell or offer for
sale or barter any goods, wares, merchandise, food, confection or drink upon
any street or sidewalk or any other City owned property within the City except
in accordance with all of the following provisions:
      (1)   No merchandise shall be displayed or sold except in the locations
designated in the rules and regulations of the City Manager or his designee.
      (2)   No merchandise shall be displayed or sold in a manner that blocks,
obstructs or restricts the free passage of pedestrians or vehicles in the
lawful use of the sidewalks, streets or public places or ingress or egress to
the abutting property.
      (3)   All merchandise shall be displayed or sold from portable tables,
carts or containers as approved by the City Manager or his designee. Each
vendor shall remove all merchandise, packaging, paper, display tables, carts or
containers, or other materials brought to the location at the termination for
sales each day.
       (4)   No vendor's table, cart, container or other appurtenances,
paraphernalia, merchandise, supplies or sign age shall occupy an area more than
three (3) feet in width and eight (8) feet in length. Food truck vendors must
vend onto the sidewalk or open space which is not within the street.
      (5)   Each vendor during the period of selling shall keep the area within
ten (10) feet of the location where the vendor sells or displays merchandise
free from all litter and debris arising from the operations, including the
litter which arises from action of customers in disposing of wrapping or
packaging materials of merchandise sold by the vendor.
      (6)   Vendors shall at all times exercise reasonable care that their
merchandise, packaging material, display equipment and other paraphernalia
shall not create a safety or health hazard to customers or other persons using
the public streets, sidewalks or public places, or to persons on or in abutting
property.
      (7)   No street sales shall be conducted nor shall any display table,
cart, container or other appurtenances be permitted on any public property
between the hours of 12:00 midnight and 6:00 a.m. daily. Any other ordinance
prescribing more restrictive hours shall prevail.
      (8)   No items of a pornographic nature shall be sold or displayed by
street merchants.
      (9)   The playing of any radio, phonograph, or any musical instrument or
device in such a manner or with such volume as to annoy or disturb the quiet
comfort and repose of store owners, employees or patrons in the central vending
district is prohibited pursuant to other provisions of the Codified laws of the
City.
   (b)   Nothing in this section shall be construed to prohibit the
distribution or the sale of newspapers on the sidewalks. (Ord. 15406. Passed 5-
5-20.)
780.06 COMPLIANCE WITH GUIDELINES.
   The City Manager, through his designee and the Finance Department, may
conduct site checks to determine if vendors are in compliance with the
guidelines. Upon inspection, if a violation is found, vendors are immediately
issued site check forms which indicate specific regulation violations. Vendors
will be given no more than twenty-four (24) hours to correct cited violations.
Upon the receipt of three (3) cited violations within ninety (90) days, the
City Finance Department may issue a notice terminating the license for the
remainder of the current licensing period. These provisions, as well as others
which reference licensing, compliance, hours of operation, permits, etc.,
similarly apply to businesses or trades that are vending upon private property.
(Ord. 15406. Passed 5-5-20.)
780.07 LICENSING; OPERATION WITHOUT LICENSE UNLAWFUL;FAILURE TO DISPLAY LICENSE
UNLAWFUL.
   No person shall engage in the business or trade of street vendor without
first obtaining a license from the City Finance Department. The license shall
be displayed conspicuously at all times upon the vendor's table, cart,
container or truck. Any and all additional licenses or permits required
pursuant to law shall be displayed conspicuously at all times upon the vendor's
table, cart, container or truck. Each day's operation for such business without
a license shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 15406. Passed 5-5-20.)
780.08  LICENSE FEES.
    The license fee for engaging in the trade or business of street vendor
shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00) per fiscal year, or any portion thereof.
Dishonored checks shall be subject to a fifteen dollar ($15.00) return check
fee in addition to the one hundred dollar ($100.00) license fee. For Food
Trucks that wish to occupy a parking space whether metered or not, permission
to do so is by discretion of the City Manager or his designee who will assign
such permissible space and the cost per day or any part thereof is thirty
dollars ($30.00) per space. For Food Trucks, this provision prevails over any
other provision referencing parking meter usage, or parking generally,
otherwise found in the Codified Ordinances of the City. (Ord. 15406. Passed 5-
5-20.)
780.09 APPLICATION AND ISSUANCE OF VENDOR'S LICENSE; GENERAL LIABILITY
INSURANCE REQUIRED; PROCEDURES
   (a)   Each applicant for a vendor's license shall file an application with
the City Finance Department in such form as prescribed the Department. The
applicant may be an individual or a firm or corporation on behalf of an
individual. In the case where a person, firm or corporation applied for the
license on behalf of an individual, the license shall be issued in the name of
the applicant; and the license shall also bear the name of the vendor on whose
behalf the license is issued.
   (b)   All food vendor applicants under Classification C of Section
780.04(c) shall submit with their application evidence of approval from the
Wheeling/Ohio County Health Department for the type of food to be sold.
   (c)   No license shall be issued or shall remain in effect unless such
vendor can demonstrate to the City Manager or his designee proof of general
public liability insurance in the aggregate sum of five hundred thousand
dollars ($500,000.00), naming the City as additional insured and further
indicating that any insurance carried by the City of Wheeling is excess and in
no way contributory or quota share, with assurance that the City will be
advised by the insurance carrier if the insurance is canceled. In addition,
such vendor, as consideration for the City granting a license to the vendor,
enters into a hold-harmless agreement with the City by the submission of the
application and licensing process.
   (d)   All street vendor applicants shall be given a copy of the rules and
regulations for street vendors and are charged with knowledge of such rules and
regulations.
(Ord. 15406. Passed 5-5-20.)
780.10  REVOCATION.
   The violation of any requirement of this division, or of any rule or
regulations promulgated pursuant to this division, or of any ordinance or law
shall be grounds for immediate revocation of the vendor's license by the City
Manager or his designee.   
(Ord. 15406. Passed 5-5-20.)
780.11 APPEAL OF REVOCATION.
    Any vendor who feels aggrieved by the revocation of the vendor's license or
other adverse action taken by the City Manager or his designee, or the Finance
Department through the Finance Director may, by filing a written request with
the City Manager or his designee within ten (10) days, obtain reconsideration
by the City Manager or his designee. If requested, the vendor shall be entitled
to a formal hearing before the City Manager or a hearing examiner designated by
the City Manager in order to provide the vendor with an opportunity to show
that the action taken was incorrect or contrary to law, in whole or in part,
after which hearing, the City Manager shall, within a reasonable time, give
notice in writing of his decision. Such appeal, unless and until the ruling of
the City Manager is modified or rescinded, shall not affect any stay of the
action taken which is being appealed. Further appeal may be taken by the vendor
to the circuit court by certiorari in the manner prescribed by law.
(Ord. 15406. Passed 5-5-20.)

ARTICLE 781
Amusement Tax
781.01     License required; certificate fees.
781.02     Imposition and amount of tax.
781.03    Statements and payments.
781.04     Records of admissions, inspections.
781.05     Insufficient returns by taxpayer; investigation, assessment and
collection.
781.06     Disposition of taxes collected.
781.07     Penalty for failure to pay tax when due.
781.08     Deposits by transient shows.
781.09     Forfeiture upon failure to pay tax.

781.11     Collection of tax by legal action; revocation of license for

CROSS REFERENCES
Power to levy - see W. Va. Code 8-13-6
State amusement tax - see W. Va. Code 11-13-2g
Privilege tax on amusement activities - see B.R.& T.
787.03(e)
 
781.01 LICENSE REQUIRED; CERTIFICATE FEES.
   No person shall operate or exhibit in the City any show or exhibition of any
kind described in Section
781.02 without a license therefor from the Licensing Officer. Each person to
whom a license is issued under this section shall pay a fee of fifty cents
($.50) for each license certificate to cover the cost of issuance thereof. All
such licenses herein provided for shall be issued subject to compliance with
the provisions of this article.
(Ord 3340. Passed 3-29-66.)
781.02 IMPOSITION AND AMOUNT OF TAX.
   In addition to the license fee imposed by Section
717.03, there is imposed upon every person exhibiting within the City any
circus, menagerie, circus and menagerie combined, wild west show, carnival,
caravan, fair or other itinerant or traveling show or exhibit of any type or
kind to which admission is charged, an amusement license tax of one percent
(1%) of such paid admission. For the purpose of this article, taxes imposed by
any governmental authority on such admissions or collected in connection
therewith, shall not be included in calculating the amount of such paid
admissions.
(Ord. 12260. Passed 6-5-01.)
781.03 STATEMENTS AND PAYMENTS.
   Every person exhibiting in the City any circus or other itinerant or
traveling show subject to the provisions of Section
781.02, shall, within twenty-four hours after each day of such exhibition,
submit to the City Treasurer a statement signed by such person showing the
number and respective prices of paid admissions thereto during such day, and
shall, at the same time, pay to the City Treasurer all taxes that shall have
accrued hereunder during such day. Forms for the statements required by this
section shall be furnished by the City Treasurer.
(Ord. 3340. Passed 3-29-66.)
781.04 RECORDS OF ADMISSIONS, INSPECTION.
   Every person subject to tax under this article shall keep a record of the
number and respective prices of such paid admissions and preserve such record
for a period of twelve months from the respective dates of such admissions. The
original books of entry of such person showing such record shall be open to
inspection at reasonable times within business hours by the City Treasurer or
other persons thereto authorized by the City.
(1961 Code Sec. 781.04)
781.05 INSUFFICIENT RETURNS BY TAXPAYER; INVESTIGATION ASSESSMENT AND
COLLECTION.
   If the City Treasurer has reason to believe that the tax imposed by this
article is insufficiently returned by a taxpayer, either because the taxpayer
has failed or refused to make a return, or has made an incomplete return, or
has made a return which is deficient or otherwise erroneous, he may proceed to
determine the amount of the tax for which the taxpayer is liable. The City
Treasurer may make such audits and investigations and take such evidence and
testimony as may be necessary for the purpose of his investigation.
   As a result of his investigation, the City Treasurer may assess the amount
of the tax which he finds to be due. After ten days' notice in writing to the
person assessed, he may proceed to collect the tax.
(1981 Code Sec. 781.05)
781.06 DISPOSITION OF TAXES COLLECTED.
   All taxes received by the City Treasurer under the provisions of this
article shall be deposited in the General Fund.
(1961 Code Sec. 781.06)
781.07 PENALTY FOR FAILURE TO PAY TAX WHEN DUE.
   A taxpayer who fails to file his return or to remit the tax when due shall,
in addition to the liability for the tax, pay a penalty of five percent (5%) of
the amount of the tax due for each thirty days elapsing before payment.
(1961 Code Sec. 781.07)
781.08 DEPOSITS BY TRANSIENT SHOWS.
   Every person applying for a license for any show or exhibition described in
Section
781.02, shall, with such application, deposit with the City Treasurer as
security for the payment of the tax imposed herein the sum of one hundred
dollars ($100.00) for each exhibition of circus or menagerie or like show; the
sum of ten dollars ($10.00) for each side show in connection with such circus
or like show; the sum of five dollars ($5.00) for each separate entertainment
or exhibition for which a fee is charged at any street or other carnival; and
the sum of ten dollars ($10.00) for any other public show.
(Ord. 3340. Passed 3-29-66.)
781.09 FORFEITURE UPON FAILURE TO PAY TAX.
   Upon the failure of any such person to make the return and pay the tax
required under this article such deposit shall be forfeited and paid into the
General Fund and such person shall be subject to all penalties herein otherwise
provided.
(1961 Code Sec. 781.09)
781.10 REFUND OF TAXES.
   The City Treasurer may refund any taxes erroneously paid by any person if
claim therefor be made to the City Treasurer within four months after the
payment of such taxes. Such claim shall be in writing and accompanied by an
affidavit of a credible person verifying the correctness of such claim.
(1961 Code Sec. 781.10)
781.11 COLLECTION OF TAX BY LEGAL ACTION; REVOCATION OF LICENSE FOR NONPAYMENT.
   If any person fails to pay any tax required under this article when due and
payable, the City may collect the same by any proper legal action. In addition
thereto any City license for any show or exhibition described in Section
781.02 shall be subject to revocation by Council at any meeting thereof after
ten days; written notice of the time, place and purpose of the meeting shall
have been given to such person by the City Clerk. Such person may attend such
meeting and make any proper defense before Council.
(1961 Code Sec. 781.11)
781.12 PERFORMANCES EXCEPTED.
   The tax imposed under provisions of this article shall not apply to any
performance or show given for the sole benefit of any religious, charitable,
benevolent or educational association or purpose.
(1961 Code Sec. 781.12)
781.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this article shall be fined not less than
ten dollars ($10.00) nor more than one hundred dollars ($100.00) or imprisoned
not more than thirty days, or both. Each violation shall constitute a separate
and distinct offense.
(Ord. 7500. Passed 3-9-82.)
ARTICLE 783
Horse and Dog Race Tracks
783.01     Tax imposed.
783.02     Exception.
783.03     Amount of tax.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to levy - see W. Va. Code 8-13-8
State law provisions - see W. Va. Code 19-23-1 et seq.
 
783.01 TAX IMPOSED.
   There is hereby levied upon the operator of a horse or dog race track within
the City limits a license tax for the privilege of conducting horse or dog
racing.
(Ord. 6044. Passed 8- 10-76.)
783.02 EXCEPTION.
   The license tax herein imposed shall not be applicable to any local, county
or State fair, horse show or agricultural or livestock exposition at which
horse racing or dog racing is conducted for not more than six days.
(Ord. 6044. Passed 8-10-76.)
783.03 AMOUNT OF TAX.
   The license tax shall be two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) per day for
each and every day that horse racing is conducted at any such horse race track,
and one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00) per day for each and every day that dog
racing is conducted at any such dog race track. Such taxes shall be payable to
the City Treasurer upon each and every such day.
(Ord. 6044. Passed 8-10-76.)
ARTICLE 785
Liquor Sales Tax
785.01     Tax imposed upon purchase at retail.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to tax - see W. Va. Code 8-13-7
Liquor control - see GEN. OFF. Art.
521
Nonintoxicating beer - see B.R.& T. Art.
741
Private clubs - see B.R.& T. Art.
750
Wine dealers - see B.R.& T. Art.
778
 
785.01 TAX IMPOSED UPON PURCHASE AT RETAIL.
   After the effective date of this section, pursuant to West Virginia Code 8-
13-7, there is hereby imposed a tax of five percent (5%) of the retail purchase
price of any and all intoxicating liquors purchased from the Alcohol Beverage
Control Commissioner or from any person licensed to sell wine at retail to the
public under the provision of West Virginia Code Article 60-8, within the
corporate boundaries of the Municipality. Such tax shall be levied upon the
purchaser of such intoxicating liquor or wine, and shall be added to any
collected with the retail purchase price of such intoxicating liquor or wine.
Such tax shall be received by the Municipality from the State Treasury pursuant
to the rules and regulations adopted by the Alcohol Beverage Control
Commissioner. Provided, however, that such tax shall not be collected on
intoxicating liquors, other than wine sold by or purchased from holders of a
license issued under the provisions of West Virginia Code Article 60-7.
Provided further, such tax shall be collected upon all sales of wine to holders
of a license issued under the provisions of West Virginia Code from a wine
distributor licensed pursuant to the provisions of West Virginia Code Article
60-3 et seq.
(Ord. 7960. Passed 7-19-83.)

Privilege Tax
